website_summaries.verdict: Portable multi-use bar designed for versatility.
pros: Ergonomic handles with three grip options make it easy and comfortable to hold onto
Can be flipped over and used for sit-ups, push-ups, and arm dips
The 300-pound weight capacity makes it a great choice for most users
cons: Some users note the assembly directions are not very clear

customer_reviews.title: Fits my massive molding on my door!!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and I attached the photo I wished I found when I was shopping. I have the massive molding and was worried it wouldn’t work. But it has some holes to adjust for the molding and I’m happily lifting away!
customer_reviews.author: tuesday coren

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are delicious
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together - just four screws, tightened with the provided allen wrench. Just make sure you have several inches on either side of the doorway to accommodate the handles. Added bonus: if you have a border collie mix, he'll find the instructions delicious.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable both screws were short
customer_reviews.text: Really creazy, I bought it for my son and he was really excited, we started to attach all pieces together, wow incredible the screws which we need to attach two parts were short!!!! Can you believe it both screw was short and it was big hassle, so frustrating, my son start nagging because it was his birthday gift and now he couldn’t use it, then we came to lows and bought 2 fit screws to attach all together, he loved it but i never forget this brand do not have any QC in their product
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Screws Dont work
customer_reviews.text: This was a total mess. The screws they send you are too short to assemble the product. So, you spend half an hour unpacking everything, figuring out how it goes together only to find out that they didn't send screws that are long enough to finish the assembly. What a joke. This is insanely frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Leary

customer_reviews.title: Received a used product.
customer_reviews.text: The one i received was used. Seems in good order so will put it to use but leaves a bad taste in my mouth.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES D SON

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine yesterday. This is everything promised. Ez assembly. Sturdy when using. Great comfortable hand cushions! All I did in addition was to cut some foam pipe insulation to fit between frame and product for extra protection of door frame. Not really necessary just being cautious. See PIC! I looked for days before choosing perfect fitness. ... Worth the extra $.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reduction in quality since I bought it last
customer_reviews.text: It is sad to see that pretty much every company has succumbed to profits over quality and this company is no exception. The last one of these I bought several years ago. It was thick and sturdy and had screws and nuts to make sure things stayed in place which was especially important in the middle connection bar. When it broke, I went back to this company and decided to try them out again and I cannot recommend this product. It feels very flimsy and cheap and has nothing to hold the middle in place other than twisting it into place. If you need a pullup bar, I'd try to find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Parts do not fit.. holes are too small
customer_reviews.text: Website directs you to other items available, no support for this item. The short two allen bolts don't fit, at least the cap part is too big to connect with the other end... so i need to shop for the bolts myself i guess. On hold with support for 10 minutes and hung up.
customer_reviews.author: Mary M. Sassara

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Installation & Unsecured Product
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the worst product install I have ever experienced. Stuff doesn’t screw in properly. Flimsy bolts definitely not something I would put my full body weight on. I don’t want anything that can twist to unlock everything should be secured my bolts not by twist. Don’t risk your safety on this crap. Further the install is terrible & not worth the hassle for other products on the market that come ready to go & Secure. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: JSTAR

customer_reviews.title: Pieces do not fit together as they should
customer_reviews.text: The package arrived and had all of the parts, yet when putting the bar together one of the parts (the right curve tube assembly) did not fit into the space it was supposed to (right bent bar assembly), it was much too wide. The left side fit just perfectly, but there was no way the right side would fit together. As such, this item was a totally worthless pile of metal and plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Ivison

customer_reviews.title: Not for older houses, apartments
customer_reviews.text: What I didn't realize is you need greater than 6 inches on either side of door, a very wide area on top of door moulding, and the ability to put a piece of metal in between the wall and the door moulding. Even then I can not see this being very secure as you are relying on the moulding to hold your weight and certainly not worth the money to use only for push ups. Don't waste your money, a single bar for door would be better than this clunky thing.
customer_reviews.author: mysticbarb

customer_reviews.title: Bigger and better than most door frame pull-up bars
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * You can do a variety of different pull ups * You don't have to worry as much about elbows banging into the door frame * Easily fits a variety of door frame sizes * Easy to install without any kind of drilling or tools * Does not leave as obvious "black scuff marks" on the door frame as many other bars Cons: * Door cannot be closed, so you probably won't leave it anywhere "permanently" * Bulkier than most bars, so some may consider it more "unsightly"
customer_reviews.author: 馮

customer_reviews.title: Is this a joke?
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this product. Upon beginning the assembly process, I realized that two of the screws were too short for connecting two of the bars. Because of this I wasn't able to assemble the product and have to return it. Not sure if I would trust this seller if their product doesn't even come with the correct parts.
customer_reviews.author: irina

customer_reviews.title: can't set it up, defective bolts.
customer_reviews.text: system is held together by bolts and allen nuts along tubes. sadly for one of the bolts (the carriage one), its allen nut is too think for the tube, rendering the entire pull up bar useless. i can't believe I will have to return the entire thing plus accessories because of a basic mistake like that. I'll prefer for them to send me a bolt/allen nut replacement, but that's not one of the options.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Frota

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bar
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and I can attest that it doesn't leave any marks on my door frame. I had no issues with any of the parts or install and it seems solid and durable. I am currently mainly using it to anchor resistance bands (bodylastics) and do various exercises with them (lat pulldowns, triceps pushdowns, rows, etc.), along with some occasional pullups, and the bar holds up very well. The wide, angled bar provides flexibility for different hand positions and mounting points. I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JDA

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay
customer_reviews.text: Had a pull up bar like this when I was younger. Tried to go for this budget friendly version bc the reviews seemed decent. After 30 minutes post assembly I've resigned to the fact that I'm probably going to cut my losses, give it away, and buy a better bar. The rubber on this thing is horrendous. It did an immaculate job of stripping paint off of my doorway the brief time I had it mounted. At the very least go for the wide grip bar which seems to have greater surface area and appears to be the model that's getting most of the 4-5 star reviews.
customer_reviews.author: cowherdingjoe

customer_reviews.title: Destroys doorframes!
customer_reviews.text: This was great for a few uses, but over time it has destroyed my door frame. I'm a pretty light guy, 160lbs. I have great pull-up form as well as I am prior military. The way the wide grip is set up, and how it sits on the door, however, has destroyed the frame, the drywall, and has started to crack all the way up my ceiling molding. I want a refund please...
customer_reviews.author: ryan michael lawson

customer_reviews.title: Should be better
customer_reviews.text: Putting this together was easy. Yet due to the type of molding around my door cold not use just anywhere. The product sat for a couple of months. When I finally got around to trying using it again the padding started slipping. Disappointed at this especially for the price, you'd expect this product to not have these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Braima Massaquoi

customer_reviews.title: This item exceeded my expectations for sure!
customer_reviews.text: I got this and was worried because of negative reviews but they are all bs I got the whole family on the bar to test it and everything went great and I weigh a good 180-200lbs im a big guy and this thing works very good. If you are needing a pullup bar dont go with those others and get this one its worth the extra money the grips seem very sturdy as well ill update if things change I had the white one along time ago but im very impressed with this version.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions are worthless
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions are the worst. The paint or coating on the inside and the screws flakes off and caused a huge mess. My husband originally attempted to put it together on the carpet and made a huge mess. He couldn’t figure out the instructions so I moved it to the linoleum and figured it out based on the picture on the box. The assembly instructions are that bad. Once it was assembled, it is easy to install and take down for storage. It holds my husband’s weight and hopefully will keep him going while the gyms are closed.
customer_reviews.author: Not today

customer_reviews.title: Quality Pullup Bar
customer_reviews.text: I needed a pullup bar since my gym is currently closed and this is great! I ordered a different one for the same price but came missing pieces so I was lucky to find this available. The quality of this one is much better than the other one I will be returning. I'd recommend this. Also really easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Chin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and take down
customer_reviews.text: As a renter, I wanted a pull up bar that wouldn't require altering the walls. This pull up bar took about 10 minutes to assemble and I've been using it for about a week without any noticable effect on the door trim. I have it mounted on my bedroom door, and I appreciate how easy it is to take down so that I can shut the door/not have it in the way after use. My husband, who weighs 170lbs, has tried it out as well. We were a bit concerned about the door trim holding him, but it's continued to hold up without issue.
customer_reviews.author: A. Temple

customer_reviews.title: Beware - Important measurment info left out of item description!
customer_reviews.text: Be very careful before buying!!! The item description mentions the doorway width requirements, but does not mention the doorway width requirements. If you live in an older home, your doorways may be too deep. Mine are 5.5 inches which is way too deep for this pull up bar. It is completely useless to me. To add to the dissapointment, the company has not responded to either of my 2 messages.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Loughman

customer_reviews.title: Didn't like the grip distance, first one arrived bent
customer_reviews.text: My first bar would not assemble correctly. The pads that were supposed to be up against the wall were slightly askew which made the bar pretty much unusable. The replacement that Amazon sent assembled fine, but the instructions were still hard to follow. My biggest problem was with the distance of the grips. The grips that jut out were right where my hands naturally landed. I dont want to do weird pushups... i just want to do regular and reverse grip but i just cant be comfortable with the spacing of the grips Had to send it back
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Company Ships DEFECTIVE Items
customer_reviews.text: Similar to the other reviews around receiving a product that is missing pieces or defective... I too received a defective pull up bar. The Foam pads are uneven and some are deprecated. the picture shows one of the handles that look as if someone shaved off pieces of the foam, left and right are so different. Its also as if it was used and then shipped.. For this price, there should be a quality standard... I am looking to get some sort of compensation for this defect whether it is a full refund or full replacement. This is unacceptable
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: GOT SCREWED AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product once and it has missing bolts/hardware to install.. I returned it and order a second one thinking it was just a fluke - well the second order has all the wrong hardware. Non of the bolts are long enough to install this. And don’t bother trying to talk to someone at perfect fitness, they don’t answer the phones and the mailbox is full in order to leave a message. The worst QA I have ever seen. What a joke of a company.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Lithdale

customer_reviews.title: Stable even without installing the metal hook
customer_reviews.text: This pull up bar was easy to assemble with a clear instruction manual and a complete toolkit. I opted out of installing the specific metal hook because I'm currently renting and didn't want to damage the door frame. The pull up bar was still stable for me (5'5", 130 lbs) even without the hook, and I am only 1-2 inches off the ground when i bend my knees to deadhang. I like being able to put it on and off the doorframe as needed. The foam grips around the bars are nice, they help me keep my grip on the bar more stable so that I can start off with longer holds than if it was a bare bar.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: My item came missing the screws for assembly. I tried to contact the manufacturer and left two messages on their support line. I then had to wait a hour to try to talk to someone and finally just hung up. Their Customer service is not good.
customer_reviews.author: MitoMan

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Perfect Multi-Gym Sport to try to stay active while all the gyms are closed. The product is easy to install and fits my 30" door frame well. I'm disappointed that after only about 100 pull ups, one of the plastic O-rings that go between the metal bars broke. This hasn't greatly affected the functionality, but I'm disappointed to say the least. The product also advertises that it's good for dips, however, the product is only a few inches off the ground so you can't actually use it to get a full extension on a dip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Less sturdy than original, works ok though.
customer_reviews.text: I owned the original model and liked it a lot but left it with some friends when I moved out. Bought this one and I have to say it feels way less sturdy than the original model did. When not mounted there is a lot of flex due to the plastic bar that goes over the door trim. It seems to be working fine but the plastic bar just doesn't seem like it will last. Time will tell. 4 stars since it's working fine so far, the original was worthy of 5 though.
customer_reviews.author: JCBCJ

customer_reviews.title: Not every door frame can handle this product.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself seems to be okay, even though I can’t really use it anywhere in my house, as it’s designed for doorframes, but not ever door frame can handle it. I went to use for the 3rd time today, and was startled as the top of the door frame wood snapped, resulting in me falling to the ground. Now, this isn’t the product’s fault, but it is important to determine whether your door frames are large and sturdy enough to handle this kinda weight and pressure. Mine apparently aren’t. If I can’t put it up on any of these frames, then it has little use to me.
customer_reviews.author: Sarkis Barbarian

customer_reviews.title: Just get this one
customer_reviews.text: This is my first in-home pull-up bar. I've wanted one for awhile but had gym access until, well, you know. I looked at several and my gut said get this one...Yay, gut! Great, sturdy product, I love having 3 grip choices. We just keep it up in the doorway because we can both walk beneath it without bonking our heads on it (it's 6 inches below the top of the doorway). Leaving it up there keeps it in your face so you use it more. I hang on it at least twice a day (haven't gotten any taller yet, but a girl can dream).
customer_reviews.author: Phoebe

customer_reviews.title: Great bar especially if you have large trim!
customer_reviews.text: Check out my video for more details. Works great for me. I have larger 5.5" inch trim at the top of my door. Most other pull up bars will not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple assembly and installation. Easily remove and re-install as needed. No fasteners required.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly and installation was very simple. Just follow the included directions. As with anything I assemble myself, I recommend giving yourself a little space, and organizing the pieces and parts before you get started. I like that this hangs in the doorframe without any fasteners to damage the wall and can be removed, stored, and rehung just as easily each time.
customer_reviews.author: Josh H.

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband. He had some difficulty assembling it. One of the grove holes did not match up without the help of a hammer to pound it in but eventually came together. Easy to mount onto a doorway, just make sure it's facing the correct way. There was some bend in the bar with weight on it but I think it's supposed to be that way. Satisfied enough.
customer_reviews.author: Emily L.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all folks. I purchased this pull up bar bc I would constantly be putting OT on work and I didn’t really have time for the gym. Let me tell you, this is by far one of the best quality pull up bars I’ve purchased (considering the price). I use it 3 times a week (Monday wed fri) and it causes no damage to my doorframe (unlike previous pull up bars I’ve owned). It’s a great tool if you’re looking forward to STAYING in shape. Really helps out on those days that I’m too busy to go to the gym:
customer_reviews.author: Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a bar like this but gave it away. It’s a classic, though. No permanent bolts or hardware in the door frame. I still take it slow on pull-ups because I do not feel comfortable jerking the bar around, but probably shouldn’t be jerking myself up anyways. It is low enough to the floor that I have to keep my legs bent to not touch the floor. But, it’s a decent product at a reasonable price. It does what it was intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and precisely made
customer_reviews.text: This is a much better product than the doorway bars I've used in the past. Don't get me wrong---the materials are cheap and you get what you pay for. However the drill holes cuts are more precise, the pieces are more made well and fit together much better, and the design is more flexible. All in all it's a solid product.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: This pull up bar has a nice and easy set up
customer_reviews.text: This pull up bar has a nice and easy set up. It can be removed from the door and it has enough foam cushions to not damage the door frame. Make sure you follow the instructions and set it up appropriately. Also, be sure it is secure when using it. I weigh about 180 lbs and it holds my weight with no problem. Great for grip training. Now I have no excuse to not train to do pull ups.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. R.

customer_reviews.title: Solid pull up bar!
customer_reviews.text: Solid product. I’ve been using it daily since the pandemic started. Just be careful because the handles are metal and can press into your wood trim easily. I put a towel in between each handle and my wall to protect the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Spikedlee

customer_reviews.title: Missing piece
customer_reviews.text: I received it with the bar the cannot be put together since the tow pieces that form it are the same. Thus, one piece cannot slide into the other one. I was not able to contact the seller. I am very disappointed. especially because in this time that could have helped me to do some physical exercise.
customer_reviews.author: audrey

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could Keep it - but doesn't fit inner depth of door
customer_reviews.text: When I went to purchase this for my teen son, I was more concerned with the dynamics of how it worked compared to other products. It does state the size door opening that it will work with (read carefully). It fits up to a 6" inner door measurement. We have an 8.25" inner door opening, therefore the product can't be used. That being said, it looks like a well made and great designed product.
customer_reviews.author: AnaBanana

customer_reviews.title: mostly does what it says
customer_reviews.text: works well but i had to screw in a piece of wood over my door to use this inside. maybe my cheap apt is not up to code but this would not work on any door without modification. if you have doors with the molding surrounding the door frame then you should be good. it gets loose over time and needs some tightening.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel McCollum

customer_reviews.title: Great multifunctional bar
customer_reviews.text: Have purchased this it fits well in the doorway hasn't left any marks as a damaged anything is very stable works good for both Pull-Ups and using as a sit-up brace haven't really tried it for dips easy to put together seems to be of good quality no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Ruff

customer_reviews.title: Great Product! Exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I paid a little more for this than similar products but it was worth it to get a quality product. It's easy to assemble, easy to install, and it's adjustable to fit a variety of door openings. It feels sturdy so I can do my exercises with confidence that it won't fall apart. So far it hasn't left any marks. It's also small and light enough to carry around, although I wouldn't take it on a plane. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Ramon S.

customer_reviews.title: Pull up bar itself is nice, but the nuts and bolts that came with ...
customer_reviews.text: Pull up bar itself is nice, but the nuts and bolts that came with it are so cheap, all of them stripped before I could tighten them all the way. Taking them back apart was a pain in the butt because obviously, stripped bolts. I ended up buying my own nuts and bolts at home depot. It's now fully assembled and it's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert H.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It’s a good price, it’s simple, and effective. Cons: It was kind of a pain in the butt to assemble because the screws never screwed in all the way and that was concerning, one time I was swinging on it (I know I probably shouldn’t) and it fell down, and one of the black grips wasn’t sturdy so it would always spin around. Overall even though it seems like it’s a bad product based on what I said I still use it everyday and it really improved my upper body strength.:)
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Steeds

customer_reviews.title: Got it to work, but with problem in my doors
customer_reviews.text: I have a 60+ year-old house the top of the door frames are 5 inches vs 3 inches, so the unit does not install level for the short parts to be parallel to the floor. But can use it for the other features.
customer_reviews.author: JWP

customer_reviews.title: More adjustable than they specify!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased that this pull up bar -- the pro version-- is so very adjustable for deeper door frames. The specs say 6 inches deep, however I was able to easily remove the door pads on the sides to allow more depth for my 8 inch deep door frame.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I did not want to add 1 single star. I do not usually waste my precious time writing reviews but this one needed to be written. Parts were missing and some parts did not fit but the company got my money. Do better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY! Can’t be assembled with hardware included in box
customer_reviews.text: The assembly hardware that comes in the box is not compatible with the pieces whatsoever. The bolts are about half an inch too short. Extremely frustrating and not sure how they get away with selling a product that literally can’t even be put together with the pieces they give you. Complete waste of time and money. And it’s just as big of a hassle to try and fit all the irregular sized pieces back into the box for return. Do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pull up bar.
customer_reviews.text: My gym closed due to covid and I needed something to add to my kettle bell routines. This pull up bar is very easy to assemble and I had it in my door frame within 20 minutes of receiving it. It also functions in other ways for different exercises so you can work your abs, chest, and tris if you need to. Overall im very satisfied with this purchase and has helped me stay in shape until my gym reopens. If you need a cheap door frame bar, this one is pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: J Adolpho

customer_reviews.title: Almost Really Good
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to give this 5 stars as the product was easy to put together and feels sturdy. My only grip is that I have had the product just a few weeks, weight only 185lbs, and the pads that are supposed to protect the door frame have failed and caused damage to my framing. I have used a similar product before without damage. I expect I will have to find and apply additional padding to prevent further damage.
customer_reviews.author: Customer 1

customer_reviews.title: Make sure your door has reinforcements
customer_reviews.text: After a couple weeks of using I snapped the upper door jamb frame because they are commonly inserted with two thin nails from a nail gun. After buying and painting a replacement I secured it with 10 nails and it’s holding well now but if you have a basic installation this will break your door
customer_reviews.author: SPQR

customer_reviews.title: poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: the foam is so thin that the metal frame almost leaves an indentation on the frame of the door. the top portion where it hands over the door frame, does not sit flush- leaving you nervous after each pull up. keep looking,.
customer_reviews.author: EvenKeel

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The bar holes don't line up properly to put the screws in. Cheap cheap cheap!
customer_reviews.author: galina

customer_reviews.title: Seems great so far
customer_reviews.text: I put this up in the doorway to my home office and use it several times per day as I walk under it. I was a little concerned about the strength of it but it seems sturdy enough, I weigh 180lbs, much more than that I'd be cautious. I just ensure my legs are not tucked right up just in case it ever fails, not that it appears likely to right now. For the price this thing is great. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew McClymont

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to put up and take down
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my 15 year old son, easy to assemble he did it on his own. Only complaint is it doesn't fit all doorways the same but other than that it's great..didn't damage doorway or trim in anyway which is great Easy to put up and take down, it's very lightweight
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: IT DAMAGED THE DOOR FRAME!
customer_reviews.text: After about one month of use, there is a significant damage of the door frame from rubber parts rubbing against the door frame.
customer_reviews.author: ED

customer_reviews.title: Does not work for pull ups
customer_reviews.text: The picture always shows the person that does pull ups only from shoulders up because it’s impossible to do pull ups with this product, it’s way too low, not good for door frames
customer_reviews.author: carlo

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: Was excited to receive this pull up bar as most of the reviews were good and the independent reviews seemed good too. Sadly, the reviews citing manufacturing defects were spot on. Literally, on step #1 of the assembly instructions, there was a critical defect in the horizontal bars causing them to fit together with one wall pad facing the completely opposite direction. The bar had been "crimped" on the opposite (wrong) side, causing the two pieces to fit in different directions. This renders everything completely useless. I'll change my rating if they manage return / replace cycle well, but am not holding my breath. :((
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Fraud
customer_reviews.text: There are no screws bolts, washers or tools, not even a single thing came in the box. I demand a refund asap
customer_reviews.author: Professor MSW

customer_reviews.title: Great product for upper body and core exercise
customer_reviews.text: Product is sturdy, easy to install and doesn't dent or damage your wall or door jam. The only negative is the the width of the wide angle grip. While it's too wide for me, there is an non padded section that works just fine. Leave it up and you can do a pull up or chin up every time you pass under. It has 5 inches of clearance below the door jam. So for a standard door, you have 6'3" clearance
customer_reviews.author: akos54

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Product was easy to assemble and does exactly as advertised. I’m about 6’1” and weigh approximately 190 lbs. Supports me with no issues. My only complaint is the packaging used for shipment. The item was previously owned and parts were scattered everywhere. The return label from the previous buyer was even in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D.

customer_reviews.title: Well built, good value!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design and well built. I can see how the padding can move around after lots of use but that would happen with any type of padded grips I think. I really like the wide grip option and how well it is executed. The only issue is that the padding that protects the door frame will definitely flatten to the point where it will leave a mark but that can be stopped by putting a piece of cardboard or maybe a hand towel inbetween? I also like how the padding is wide and distributes the weight more evenly than a typical bar would. Very good value as well! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One glitch in assembly, good product
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was a bit tricky like others have said. I had trouble on the very first step until I stopped reading the directions and looked at the actual parts for how they should go together. I was able to spot the notch and groove that should latch into each other between the left and right pieces of the main bar. After that assembly was a breeze. Fits great on my 30" doorway and works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Pinnwort

customer_reviews.title: My favorite home gym equpiment
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! The different grip positions is wonderful. I can do chin ups, pull ups, hanging leg raises, and there is even enough space between the bar and the door frame that I can get my legs through the space and do upside down hanging sit ups.
customer_reviews.author: C. HollyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and good value
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy I purchased this before the quarantine. It’s so easy to assemble and it’s been helping me stay in shape! It was able to support both of my parents dangling from it no problem (around 250 pounds?). I’ve been using almost everyday and the handle pads haven’t worn down or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L

customer_reviews.title: Works Great Still
customer_reviews.text: So far so good holds 206 LBS just fine. (5 month update) still works great. Grips have a flat spot from storing it on a hard surface. That isn’t a problem for me though. Bar started cracking the drywall at the top of the doorway. So I bought a piece of flat steel, for $7 at Home Depot and drilled some holes in it and mounted it up. Problem solved. Now the paint on the sides of the door at getting rubbed off. I’m thinking maybe an old shirt zip tied to the sides of the bar might work.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Bolts are too short!  Must be for a different model
customer_reviews.text: Bolts are entirely too short to assemble. The long screws are not long enough, neither are the short ones.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Rae

customer_reviews.title: Othere than the screws the product is good
customer_reviews.text: Love this product, iv looked and read on every pull up bar online and ended up getting this one. Like most of the posters have stated the screws that came with it are S*** , so I went to hardware store and got better ones. Pros: Lite weight Easy to use Cons: Screws are crap **Edit** 4/18/2020 still have it after 2 years now and use it everyday. No problems and still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The instructions came crumpled up and torn. However, it was easy to assemble. On the first try I heard a crack from my door frame, but there was no visible damage. I measured my door frame before ordering and it fits perfectly. It works great
customer_reviews.author: Amy S

customer_reviews.title: Best bar out there hands down
customer_reviews.text: Best bar out there hands down. It take about 20 minutes to set up (I did it with my sister). I use it everyday and to physically put it up on the doorway takes about 2 seconds. There is not other option. Don't get one that's permanent and bolts in because the way this is built is great. 100% recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this gadget
customer_reviews.text: Love this gadget, sturdy, durable, only that it's actually a bit large for the width of my door frame, so the cushion can't be laid flat and support better. But the quality of this product is good. Please check if you have enough space on both left and right side outside your door frame for the handles to lie on.
customer_reviews.author: Louisa Tsang

customer_reviews.title: What a pullup bar should be
customer_reviews.text: Great pull up bar that hasnt let me down. Girlfriend was using it the wrong way so I swiftly reprimanded her and advised her of the proper use. Only downside it the wide handles arent that useful with the metallic sides. They grind into my hands. Easy to assemble and set up.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Bar
customer_reviews.text: This bar has been awesome for my gymnastic daughter. It stays in her doorway, but it's very easy to remove. She uses it frequently and it has not left any type of marks on the door frame. My husband is over 250 lbs and he uses it for pull ups. After a few months, it got loose from use, but tightening it was a simple turn of the screws. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: L.Seay

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pullup bar, no marks on frame!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and really awesome addition to fitness equipment. Easy to take off and put aside. Can be used for pushups and tricep dips as well. A bit of weight to it so you can use it as such too if preferred
customer_reviews.author: An6muny4

customer_reviews.title: Unprofessional packaging along with wrong parts that do not allow assembly
customer_reviews.text: The screws provided are not even long enough to hold bar together. Looks like a last second package job, I assume they put the wrong screws inside after someone else returned this item. Instructions say to put “plastic-o-ring” between both bars, but the long Allen bolt isn’t even long enough to reach the other end! Can’t even fasten it, so safe to say my assembly couldn't even get past step 1. Returned as soon as it was received.
customer_reviews.author: Osama Mohammad Siddiqui

customer_reviews.title: Super easy installation.  Very safe
customer_reviews.text: I love this. Got it at the beginning of Rona when it was clear I wouldn’t be getting into the gym for awhile (I may never go back now as my home routine is more effective). Only problem is, after having this for a month, I went online to order a second one to keep at my friend’s house, and the prices had almost tripled. Unreal.
customer_reviews.author: John Sloop

customer_reviews.title: Exceptionally well built
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Elite version and couldn't be happier with the purchase. The unit is exceptionally well designed and the materials are great. It assembles quickly and solidly and fits our doorway with 5" molding perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Damaged my door frames
customer_reviews.text: It damages my door frames. Leaves indentations and I had part of my door frame start to split. I'm only 180lbs. Be careful with your door frame. If you hear a creaking sound, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bolts are too short—can’t assemble
customer_reviews.text: The bolts it came with aren’t long enough, so I’m unable to even put it together until I can get to a hardware store to buy ones that are. I followed the instructions and even tried other ways, but they don’t fit at all.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Solid pull-up bar, but not great for tall people
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and mount, but at 6'1 I find the height of it in a standard door frame to be too low. This is probably a problem with most of the door-mounted pull-up bars on standard-sized doors. I found myself using it a lot less than I thought I would be due to the height of it and inherent awkwardness of doing exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: What you'd expect, though the grips shouldn't rotate the way they do.
customer_reviews.text: Took about 10 minutes to assemble. Slightly annoying, as grips tend to rotate as you're exercising, which is not ideal. Still seems like the best option for my current living situation with small doorways.
customer_reviews.author: John Vantine

customer_reviews.title: Very Secure!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've been nervous about using a doorway pull-up bar, but decided to just go for it after reading the reviews on this one specifically. It was very easy to assemble, and once on the door frame, felt very secure. My dad even tried it (weighs 220 lbs), and it held up! I wasn't able to attach the safety clip, so I just make sure it's flush against the wall above the door before I use it. Super pumped to increase my pull-up count!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product is easy to assemble and arrived as pictured
customer_reviews.text: Product is easy to assemble and arrived as pictured. The biggest negative is that the pads between the handles and the door frame are cheap quality. After about two weeks of use they "gave out" and there are now dents and scratches on my door frame...
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS AWFUL JUNK.
customer_reviews.text: I've had to use power tools to assemble. its components are not well adjusted, the tools are incomplete and whoever designed this thing should be shot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Design
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble once I realized the two main sections that notch together are not meant to screw tight but held together once all the pieces are in place. So easy to use over the door. I also attach bands to help with the pullups. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: C Puccia

customer_reviews.title: It's exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this pull up bar regularly for months now. I love it! It stays in place and feels very stable. I've even tested out doing pull-ups while trying to make my body horizontal and it holds like a champ (5'11" 190lbs). I've also seen my pull up numbers increase so its helping with the gains!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product. The assembly was fairly easy and I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. The assembly was fairly easy and I was pleasantly surprised by the heft of the assembled bar. It attaches and removes easily from a door. The only thing, which really can't be helped, is that you need to hook your knees up to do the pull ups. This might be a problem if you are 6'2" and have long arms - you knees might hit. Most importantly, it gives no signs of damaging the door.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Benak

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defects
customer_reviews.text: Unable to assemble due to manufacturing defect. The left and right bars have to be fastened by twisting it so that the notches on one bar are in the L-shaped channel on the other bar. But as you can see in the picture, there are 2 notches and only one channel/groove. Reading the reviews, seems like some other buyers had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jong K Paek

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: It holds a 200 lbs man well and allows me to pump out my covid workout pull-ups and chin-ups. The wide grips are looking kind of sad, hopefully they don't rip. Everything else is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Doorframe damage
customer_reviews.text: Well more than likely I'm returning my pullup bar because it's starting to chip away my wood. My doorframe is the correct width. At first it really wasn't an issue but after a month of using the pullup bar my doorframe is damaged. I'm very disappointed because I thought I finally found a pullup bar that wouldn't cause damage even after reading all the reviews :(.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor manufacturing
customer_reviews.text: The shipping for this item wasn’t too bad. Everything with the bar was good until I tried to assemble it. The right bar handle was larger than the left. Because of this issue, I attempted to put the screw in but it caused it to be crooked. Since it was crooked when I tried putting it on the wall it wouldn’t stay and was obviously uneven on the floor for push ups. In the end I couldn’t use it and I shipped it right back. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: A great choice if you're looking for a pull-up bar
customer_reviews.text: I like this pull up bar a lot compared to other ones I have used in the past. Seems like a lot more durable and sturdy when doing pull-ups. The one complaint I have is the screws were coming loose every so often so I added blue Loctite to the threads, no problem since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing hardware
customer_reviews.text: The sealed hardware package was missing parts! I received 3 short bolts and 1 long bolt, and only 1 plastic o-ring... I can’t assemble it without the long bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but the grips are weird
customer_reviews.text: I don't care for the felt/fabric material, it's rough on my hands compared to metal, which I would have preferred. But overall it does what it's supposed to, and has remained stable.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron

customer_reviews.title: Stays really well
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son and it has held really nicely and is very easy to take down and put back up so we can close the door.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: During my assembly process, one of the curved bars ...
customer_reviews.text: During my assembly process, one of the curved bars which connects the frame to the top cross piece would absolutely not fit into either the left or right handle pieces as well as the cross piece. I had to use a razor blade to shave off the powder coat and a hammer in order to finally get it into place. This was very frustrating as the other curved bar slide into everything as it was supposed to with ease. I was very close to giving up and returning the item.
customer_reviews.author: ALEX Goguen

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The perfect fitness multi-gym doorway pull up bar was easy to put together and fit to our doorway. We have non-standard doorways which it was still able to work just fine in. My husband and I both use it and neither have had issues. It's very solid and sturdy as it is made mostly of medal and foam-like material for where you grip the bar in possibly three different position. Definitely worth the buy especially during quarantine.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

product_meta.title: Perfect Fitness Multi-Gym Doorway Pull Up Bar and Portable Gym System
product_meta.description: The Perfect Fitness Multi-Gym is a portable gym system available in four styles. The Multi-Gym Pro, Elite, Sport, and Original can all be used as doorway pullup bars as well as for sit-ups, pushups and dips. All Perfect Fitness Multi-Gyms target arms, chest, core and back muscles with workouts that ensure maximum muscle engagement. They feature padded handles that allow for 3 grip positions to perform normal grip, close grip and hammer grip pullups. The 300 pound weight capacity makes them all safe to use with a weight vest. Multi-Gym Sport is the most compact and portable option; it stores easily and is ideal for use in smaller spaces. Multi-Gym Original and Pro feature an additional wide grip position, while the Multi-Gym Elite includes a curved, ergonomic, wide grip for maximum lat muscle engagement. Placed on the floor, all Perfect Fitness Multi-Gyms can be used for situps, pushups, and dips; padded handles provide comfort and help to ensure correct form. Multi-Gym Original, Pro and Elite feature patented door frame guards using a unique flat design with thick foam pads to help protect doorframes. All Perfect Fitness Multi-Gyms are easy to install and do not require any drilling. The Multi-Gym Sport and Multi-Gym Original securely fit door frames 27 – 35 inches wide, while the Multi-Gym Elite and Multi-Gym Pro securely fit door frames up to 33 inches wide and up to 6 inches deep. The Multi-Gym Pro also adjusts for height. All Perfect Fitness Multi-Gyms include a one year manufacturer’s warranty. Assembled dimensions: Original 15 x 38 x 14 inches; weight 6.2 pounds; Sport 11 x 36.5 x 12 inches; weight 4.8 pounds; Pro 15 x 38 x 14 inches; weight 6.2 pounds; Elite 15 x 38 x 14 inches; weight 8 pounds.
feature_bullets: Portable gym that can be used as a doorway pull up bar or turned over to perform situps, pushups, and dips; 300 pound weight capacity
Wide grip curved ergonomic handles offer three grip options for wide, close, and hammer grip pullups; padded handles ensure comfort for situps, pushups, and dips
Turn over and place on the floor for situps, pushups and dips; padded handles ensure correct form, and provide comfort
Patented door frame guard and adjustable design securely fits door frames up to 33 inches wide and up to 6 inches deep
Assembled dimensions: 15 x 38 x 14 inches, weight: 8 pounds; manufacturer's one year warranty

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
